TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ProviderConnectionPointCollection extends System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase
Public NotInheritable Class ProviderConnectionPointCollection Inherits ReadOnlyCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Contains a collection of all objects associated with a particular or server control acting as a provider in a connection. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> or server control acting as a provider in a Web Parts connection can have multiple provider connection points. One <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> object in a provider acts as the connection point for any given connection, serving as the primary interface instance to pass to one or more consumers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class contains the collection of all the connection points associated with a provider control. Several classes in the Web Parts control set need to determine what connection points are available on a provider control, and when they do they typically call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.GetProviderConnectionPoints%2A> method, which returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection.
> [!NOTE] > This class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase> class, making this collection a strongly typed, non-generic, read-only collection. You cannot add or remove members after an instance has been created.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks It is possible to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class directly from your code, but because the class inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase> class, your new collection is read-only and you cannot add or remove members after you have created it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes an empty new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class with no items in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ICollection connectionPoints) cil managed

Docs.param: An of objects used to create the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified collection of provider connection points.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> class and adds the connection points contained in the `connectionPoints` parameter.
You can use this constructor to create your own collection object of provider connection points, by creating an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> collection of existing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects, and then passing that collection to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29> constructor. However, you rarely need to create your own collection unless you are extending controls, because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control provides the necessary methods for most common operations involving provider connection points, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.GetProviderConnectionPoints%2A> method.

Docs.exception:
The collection contains a null connection point.
-or-
The collection contains an object that is not of type .
-or-
There are duplicate IDs in the collection of connection points.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint[] array, int32 index) cil managed
Public Sub CopyTo (array As ProviderConnectionPoint(), index As Integer)
public: void CopyTo(cli::array <System::Web::UI::WebControls::WebParts::ProviderConnectionPoint ^> ^ array, int index);

Docs.param: An array of objects that receives the copied items of the collection.
The starting point in the array at which to insert the collection contents.
Docs.summary: Copies the collection to an array of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.CopyTo%2A> method copies all the members of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection to a compatible, one-dimensional array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects, starting at the position in the array that is specified by the `index` parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to combine objects from different collections into a single compatible array, and then be able to access the items in the array using array methods.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Default As ProviderConnectionPoint

Docs.summary: Gets the default connection point from the collection of provider connection points associated with a particular control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property provides quick access to the provider connection point that is the default connection point within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection> collection. The default provider connection point is the primary interface used to establish and maintain a connection with consumers. Any other provider connection points in the collection provide secondary interfaces to consumers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint connectionPoint) cil managed
Public Function IndexOf (connectionPoint As ProviderConnectionPoint) As Integer

Docs.summary: Returns the position of a particular object within a collection.
Docs.returns: An integer that indicates the zero-based index position of the specified within a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPointCollection.IndexOf%2A> method is useful when there are multiple instances of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProviderConnectionPoint> objects on a page, and your code needs to know the location (or index) of one connection point object relative to the others in the collection.
If the specified provider connection point object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.

Docs.summary: Gets a specific member of the collection according to its position or a unique identifier.
